sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A persuasion from papistrie vvrytten chiefely to the obstinate, determined, and dysobedient English papists, who are herein named & proued English enimies and extreme enimies to Englande. Which persuasion, all the Queenes Maiesties subiectes, fauoring the Pope or his religion, will reade or heare aduisedlye ... Lupton, Thomas.
[4], 192, 191-316, [2] p.
Imprinted by Henrie Bynneman dwelling in Thamis Streete neare Baynards Castel, At London : Anno. 1581.
Dedication signed: Thomas Lupton. At foot of title: Cum priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis. With a final colophon leaf. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
A persuasion from papistrie vvrytten chiefely to the obstinate, determined, and dysobedient English papists, who are herein named & proued English enimies and extreme enimies to Englande. Which persuasion, all the Queenes Maiesties subiectes, fauoring the Pope or his religion, will reade or heare aduisedlye ... Lupton, Thomas.
[4], 192, 191-316, [2] p.
Imprinted by Henrie Bynneman dwelling in Thamis Streete neare Baynards Castel, At London : Anno. 1581.
Dedication signed: Thomas Lupton. At foot of title: Cum priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis. With a final colophon leaf. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Henrie Bynneman
Thamis Streete neare Baynards Castel
